replies.body: I think these changes actually hurt cho more than help. He loses a ton of lane pressure by not having ult.

Our primary goal with these changes was to give Cho'gaths that fall too far behind (lose all/most of their stacks and can't afford to build them much because they need the CD available) some better options for getting them back, without trivializing stack building. Secondary goals/effects of that change should be a bit of a jungling buff and hopefully a few extra interesting trade offs around who to ult and when. Power wise we were aiming for a slight buff overall, so if we were wrong on that and this is a nerf overall we'll likely follow up with a buff somewhere.

Meddler, if you don't mind me asking, what do you think Cho'Gath's intended role/fantasy is?

Personally, I think of him like a raidboss/protector. He does enough damage and CC threat in melee range so you don't really want to close in on him if you aren't sure you can take him head-on, but he also has some tools to deal with people attacking him from range if you use them skillfully (hitting someone in front of you to hit somebody further back with E spikes, the whole game of hitting/dodging Rupture). And yet, his enemies can capitalize on his relative immobility and relative weakness in laning phase to deal with him. The only case in which he becomes overwhelming in lane is when you're so far behind/he's so far ahead that he can just sustain through your damage - but that's somewhat true for every champion in the game.

And I can't really see you buffing him somewhere easily - his base stats are mostly above average already, with him leading the field (together with Skarner) in base AD. His abilities have good base damages and high scaling, but accessing that damage faces a fair set of restrictions (aiming or short range, his mana costs). His passive is tuned the way it is to avoid oppressiveness in lane. 

Only thing you could do there is increase his base AS a little, but lower scaling - so he stays mostly the same if not building AS, but making the stat a little bit more rewarding. But that is just a personal pet peeve of mine.

It follows the same logic as Blitzcrank, or Thresh.  Once either of those champions uses their hooks in lane, then that gives a window of opportunity for the opposing laners to engage on them.  A Blitzcrank with his hook up is scary.  A Blitzcrank without his hook is not scary.  If Cho'gath uses his ult in lane for a stack, then that gives the opponent opportunity to safely engage on him.  In this case, if he ults a minion for the 90hp bonus, it gives the opposing laner 40s of safety, where Cho'Gath has no kill potential, and forces Cho'Gath to play incredibly passively until his ult is up again.  

Please.  Play the champion before you become an expert on him.

And... before this change, ulting a minion gave your opponent 60s of safety rather than 40s. This is a buff if you choose to nom minions or monsters for your ~~snacks~~ stacks.

They lowered the window of opportunity for your opponent. That's what lowering the CD of noms on minions does. If you choose not to nom minions, as apparently you chose not to before, you will still always have your ult up. There is no change in that regard, unless you kill your lane opponent with it. In which case they're dead and window of opportunity doesn't matter nearly as much.
